text: Agree on the dev experience. Also, for those looking to optimize their app's performance, React Query's automatic data fetching on window refocus or network reconnect is a neat feature. Reduces the need for manual refetching and ensures data is always fresh.

replies.text: That automatic refetching feature saved me so much time on a project where real-time data freshness was crucial. Also, the way React Query handles query invalidation makes synchronizing data across components a breeze.

text: Has anyone integrated React Query with TypeScript? I'm curious about the type safety benefits and how well they play together.

replies.text: Yes, Samuel! React Query and TypeScript are a fantastic combo. Type safety for queries and mutations adds another layer of reliability to your app. Highly recommend giving it a try.

text: Just started using React Query in my latest project. Anyone else here using it? Would love to hear your thoughts.

replies.text: I've been using React Query for a few months now. The way it handles caching, background updates, and pagination is a game-changer. Makes client-state management so much cleaner.
